intro: Knautia alpina, commonly known as the alpine knautia, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and western Asia. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, thriving in well-drained soils and full sun. Its flowers are usually pink or purple, blooming in late summer to early autumn. Knautia alpina is often used in gardens for its ornamental value and ability to attract pollinators.
